website_summaries.verdict: Provides constant, consistent heat for medium to large rooms throughout the winter. Just be aware that it will need its own outlet.
pros: Large heat surface for faster heat-up
Thermal chimneys maximize heat flow and maintain low surface temperature
Adjustable thermostat, timer, and multiple heat settingsECO function
cons: Should not be plugged into an outlet with another plug, or used with an extension cord

customer_reviews.title: Exact review, Good heaters.
customer_reviews.text: So here is the exact scoop, I got 2 of these and one was perfect no clicking ect... the 2nd one clicked massively. I left both of them on for 2 months solid and the loud one stopped clicking. Sidebar: they do naturally click a little but I also have a small fan on at night as well that drowned out the sound. I have 2 small rooms and they heat perfectly at 68. Sidebar 2: My power bill, operating 24/7 at 68 cost me about and additional $15 a month each.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!! If you care about your safety
customer_reviews.text: The product is BROKEN after I spend half an hour carrying it upstairs and pull it out of the box. I can see wires spreading out, and I may get an electric shock if I just plug it in. Now I need to put this 26.6 pounds item back into the box and carry it down again!!! I don't even know whether I am able to do that! Stay away from this scam
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Does not last with daily home consumer use. After months of no issues, on day suddenly unit would not turn on and no lights were displayed, looks to be a power or board issue. Product warranty is too tedious and overly complicated requiring you to cut the power cord and send back for diagnosis before a replacement part or unit is sent. Looking at 4 plus weeks at least for turn around which is unacceptable when you need the product the most; in arctic Michigan winter. Avoid this and all Delonghi/ Braun/ Kenwood products which utilize the same customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Heats well - but clicks a lot
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this type of heater to forced air. This one heats well, and even has an option to dim the display, presumably to make it better for those who place it in the room where they intend to sleep. Unfortunately, it clicks loudly, often multiple times per minute, which is entirely unreasonable. If it clicked on and off every few minutes, that would be reasonable, though maybe still annoying. I just can't figure out any logical reason why it would cycle on and off three times within a single minute, as it often does. Maybe if you live in a place that's terribly cold, it will just stay on in perpetuity and not wake you up.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smithee

customer_reviews.title: VERY LOUD
customer_reviews.text: This product makes loud noise very frequently. So loud and often that we can not use it in our bedroom. I called customer service and they would only say it was normal and even though it was within the 1 yr warranty, they would not replace it. I have a Honeywell oil heater that is silent and heats better.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: Use With Caution
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it melted into my electrical socket. Glad I was home to unplug it (unit was off) before it started a fire. Now I have to replace a charred electrical socket.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: ... issue as others outlined – It makes an extremely annoying click sound during temperature modulation
customer_reviews.text: Same issue as others outlined – It makes an extremely annoying click sound during temperature modulation. Overall I liked the product except for the unbearable click sound that's very annoying during the night time. I had to eventually return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Mish

customer_reviews.title: Good heat source but......
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Heat source for a 3 Season room in New England. HOWEVER, the first time we used it, a sizable amount of oil dripped out and ruined our slate for. I just thank goodness it was not on a rug. It has stopped leaking now but we keep cardboard under it in case the oil starts dripping again. Also, the source for powering must be read carefully as it should not be plugged in an outlet with any other plug, and it says Not to use an extension cord, which is limiting.
customer_reviews.author: Deetb shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this heater. Our large bedroom and bathroom are an addition and have no heat. We live in NY and have used tower rotating space heaters in the winter that still didnt do the trick when it gets below 20 degrees. This heater is AMAZING. We use this heater and one other tower heater to heat both rooms now our bedroom and bathroom are the warmest rooms in the house. Highly recommend this heater.
customer_reviews.author: CityWife

customer_reviews.title: This unit does not throw much heat compared to the older fin units.
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to have good quality and design. But, the unit is very disappointedly weaker in heating ability than an older fin type unit we had that died. We put this on 82 degrees setting and let her run all day and night and it will not get as hot as the older unit we had. With this unit almost all the heat goes up off the top of the unit which is good if you live on the ceiling where the heat is. The sides do not get very hot which is where you want the heat. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: salt3

customer_reviews.title: This product is pure JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: It did not last one whole season and they told me it was out of warrant 3 daYS AGO! THEY SIMPLY OFFERED ME ANOTHER ON FOR 20 PERCENT OFF AND I TOLD THEM THAT EVEN IF THEY GAVE ME 50 PERCENT OFF , WHY WOULKD I BUY ANOTHER PIECE OF CRAP AGAIN THAT DOESN'T LAST 4 MONTHS OF A WINTER? SAVE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: This product was great...until we discovered that it must have had a leak and was emitting a chemical that set off our carbon monoxide detector and made my whole family seriously ill. We used it for a few weeks without any issues and one day I turned it up and within a couple of hours, enough of the chemical had concentrated in our room that the alarms went off. It was nearly odorless- but after the fire department left, we could definitely smell something off coming from the heater that we had set outside when we tried to clear the air in our apartment (we don’t have natural gas and it was the only appliance running at the time).
customer_reviews.author: Meg K

customer_reviews.title: Chicago Polar Vortex Tested
customer_reviews.text: Used these all winter long in a basement that doesn't have another heat source. Two in our basement kept a guest warm during the polar vortex. Bills get a little pricey depending on the temp but these hold their temp pretty well and can get warm. if you need a higher power space heater this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cheap packaging = damaged products
customer_reviews.text: Terrible packaging. I bought one of these 3 years ago and we love it. But this fall I’ve received multiple damaged units and keep having to return it. Either Amazon doesn’t know how to handle this product or the manufacturer is skimping on the packaging quality. Too bad - if you can get one that isn’t dented it’s a nice heater!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Faulty unit received
customer_reviews.text: Received a unit that does not work or function. I would recommend looking for a different or more reliable manufacturer if you need a space heater for your place. Update. The replacement for the broken radiation was broken as well. The back panel on the replacement was detached.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Cook

customer_reviews.title: “Acceptable” is in great condition
customer_reviews.text: Used in our 40 foot RV and it is doing well. Purchased the “acceptable” model at $55. The only damage we saw was a slight crease/dent on one side and only visible if light is on it just right. There was no manual which can be found it on the Delonghi.com site. We like the easy control panel and the smooth flat sides. It puts out a lot of heat and the ceiling fan helps distribute it. Shipping box was 3 times the size it needed to be and the top was open from packages caving it in. I wondered how many flops it did in that huge outer box.
customer_reviews.author: Ansel Adams

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommended. We bought this heater to help warm up ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommended. We bought this heater to help warm up an area that was roughly 700 square feet and the heater did a great job. We had none of the problems with smell that other reviewers reported, but I spent some time making sure that none of the packing materials were still stuck to the heater. We did have one day when the heater made a significant amount of noise (clicking) which seemed consistent with other reviewers experiences. The sounds went away though and haven't returned so far.
customer_reviews.author: parietal

customer_reviews.title: Great heater until it failed after two years
customer_reviews.text: Great heater for adding supplemental heat to our baby room. However, after exactly two years, we pulled it out of the closet to use and there appears to be something wrong with the thermostat causing the unit to cycle on and off over and over again, rendering it useless. Amazon states the unit has a three year warranty, but this is not accurate. It’s unfortunately only one year, so now we have a heater set for the landfill. On a side note, we have an old-school (non-digital) 10-year-old heater of the same brand and it’s still running strong!
customer_reviews.author: Acey

customer_reviews.title: Total train wreck sadly
customer_reviews.text: Sadly mine arrived dismantled, dented, metal piece broken off, and nothing properly fitting together even when two people tried to work on it. The timer didn’t work either. We did try to see what heat it projected. That was the only positive factor. Which if we had been given an adequate and functional product my review would most likely be positive. I’m just distressed and bothered that they would allow this to be sent to anyone. So disappointing. I had to send mine back. : (
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Is this a fraud ?
customer_reviews.text: Just received this heater and this is exactly what it looks like when it arrived. Not only broken in both the package and product, and the heater is not new but already a second hand product despite the purchase is for brand new item!
customer_reviews.author: Bwo Chau Fu

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ...for one year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January 2019, and it has worked like a champ in the winter. However, this week it simpy died. I have used these many times in the past, but they don't make them to last any more. 13 months is not a good return on the investment! The old ones lasted years. Very disappointment and, sadly, very cold right now.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina Garcia

customer_reviews.title: No clicking, smell, noise-- GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth DeLonghi heater, third model. This is great, quietest and only one that didn't stink in it's first heatings. I wouldn't even believe that if I were to read it. The others all smelled bad for a week or so at least, then the smell burned off. I accepted and expected that but DID NOT GET ANY with this one. I also expected the same popping/crackling as it would hear and haven't noticed any. Not starting from very cold, so maybe that is it? I have only used the timer once and didn't notice any clicking from a timer device, as I had with a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D

customer_reviews.title: Good heat output
customer_reviews.text: Use this unit to heat my 13x13 living room which has high 9 foot ceilings. It does a great job, has very good heat output and is totally silent. I have not experienced the clicking noise read about in other reviews. I would definitely purchase this product again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Heat Is On
customer_reviews.text: It's currently 20 degrees outside, and this heater is on. I have a family room that just doesn't get as warm as the rest of the house. And since turning up the whole house's heat for the on room, this is a logical solution. That and the fact my wife has my older version in her greenhouse. The older one I have had for a long time, so I felt comfortable in purchasing a new one from the same company. This unit is on it's second year at our house. I'm just getting around to reviewing a bunch of things I have purchased over time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Heater with automatic anti-freeze thermostat control for a garage!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this heater. I recently insulated my garage and wanted to put a heater in it so that I could warm it up when I do a project. I also wanted a heater with a feature to keep my garage from freezing so that I can store paints and other products without concern. This unit has a feature that will automatically turn it on at 41 degrees. There are additionally 3 heat settings that can be selected. It seems very well made too! I am glad that I got this unit!
customer_reviews.author: J. Harro

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This heater does it's job. But the noises that this heater gives off is not what I expected. Keep in mind, that I have 4 of the original heaters from this company and they have lasted over 10 years. They too have crackling sounds but those sounds are the sound of the oil heating up. When I purchased this newer version heater, I bought 3 of them. The other two were given to family members. They also love there heaters and have reported how warm they keep their rooms. They have not complained about noises so maybe it's just mine.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good lord, it smells bad
customer_reviews.text: It works quickly, and the controls are easy to use, but even two months later it emits an unpleasant burning smell. I’ve had to relocate it to a seldom-used room, and then I have to air it out after it warms up. I definitely wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Guide

customer_reviews.title: Heat output very good.
customer_reviews.text: Heat output-very good, some noise but was not a problem in my bedroom. Eco button was useless, Controls good except as usual the temperature setting was just a ballpark estimate. Really liked the timer turn off to turn off heater 1 hour before I get up. Heater keeps heating for a while after you turn it off. Will not turn back on after power goes out, or if you use temp or time cutoff.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Man Cave Detached Garage Stays Warm Finally
customer_reviews.text: Got this mainly for a detached garage turned man cave. Never needed a heater living in Southern California until this winter. The Man Cave was dropping into the low 40’s or high 30’s. Was looking around for the best portable heater for my situation. This Heater right here is it. After I turned it on for the first time after an hour or so you could feel the difference in the room. Very efficient. Yes there is a slight smell at first but now on day three it’s gone. No loud noise as others have reported I’m very happy with this heater and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Started Leaking Oil. a few weeks after having it only1 yr.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I probably just got a defective one. Heats very well. Use caution around children and pets as unit is hot to the touch. I'm very sad because my heater started leaking oil just a few weeks after I had it a year. Got it last January, started leaking last week! However I know people who have had them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Stupek

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this, get pelonis instead.
customer_reviews.text: So to start out, this thing emits a smell for weeks right off that smells terrible. The temperature control works but it could barely heat a large room properly at all and when compared to the much cheaper pelonis model it is nowhere near as good as the second winter of using it my house would get down to 52 degrees inside while this thing is set to 72.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2nd
customer_reviews.text: I had too large of an area for one heater, but was so impressed with this heater I bought another one. That made all the difference. All I have is an Old electric furnace which is very inefficient and runs constantly... our Highs have been in the teens. I watch my electric meter like a hawk and since I bought these two heaters my furnace seldom runs - except first thing in the morning when I get out of bed and want to take the chill off quickly. The only thing I would prefer is that the cord came out of the back instead of front. Otherwise, I can't say enough good about these heaters.
customer_reviews.author: cjudgo

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit but I don't believe that the temp setting ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit but I don't believe that the temp setting is a true thermostat. Rather, it seems to set the output level instead of adjusting to the desired temp. In other words, if you set it to 70 when the amnient temperatures is say 65, it will get the room to 70. If you set it to 70 when the ambient temp is 70, it will get the room to 75. It doesnt shut itself off when the desired temp is reached.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sedek

customer_reviews.title: Package insert says to keep away from young children
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting the package insert to say "keep away from young children" or to only have it near them when supervised (ok I know we are always supervising) but I had asked if it was safe for children and it is not. Would have bought a ceramic wall heater that could be mounted high on the wall if I had known. Also the insert says you have to keep this three feet away from the wall and can't plug in anything else in the outlet when using. I feel the advertising is a bit misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Dory949

customer_reviews.title: Excellent oil-filled radiant heater!
customer_reviews.text: This heater is solidly built, has easy to use controls, and works beautifully. Keeps my 700 square foot garage at 60 degrees without straining in temperatures down to mid-40s (we'll see how it does with lower temps this winter). A quality heater!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fredericksen

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient electric heater
customer_reviews.text: This is a very effective heater. We're using it in a cold bedroom (of a very old house) that is heated only by convection floor vents from the first floor. The legal warnings in the instruction manual made me almost afraid to use it, but I positioned it against a wall with no problem. The thermostat works well. The only problem I've encountered is that it makes a slight popping sound (due, I suppose, to differential expansion of the metal casing) every 20 seconds or so, which can be quite loud in the night stillness, and so my wife requested that I move it further from the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Rich S

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my back vestibule which had a cast iron radiator that was just about doing the job. I set the temperature at 72-74 degrees in the winter and its radiant heat keeps the vestibule perfectly cozy.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Click,click,click,click,click....will it ever stop?
customer_reviews.text: This thing I guess heats ok sometimes but mine has a problem with its thermostat. It stays 4 degrees higher that its set at, and it absolutely NEVER stops clicking...half the time its heating I get random loud annoying clicks. Far from quiet . I cant sleep with this in the room. If this does not get better ...it's going back. This seems to be a common complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Just Good Folks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Just get it!
customer_reviews.text: Really It’s all I needed to heat my bedroom or living room. No sound or smell I’ve experienced over a year now. I feel safe using it and glad that I chose this type and brand of heater. Built quality is excellent and the wheels can go in so you can store it in summer. I wish they make a model with WiFi control or remote control, nonetheless its one of the thing you feel glad you’ve bought!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if mine is broken or I don’t understand what this type of heater is supposed to do. Turn it on no heat comes out then after 5 minutes or so tiny tiny bit of heat. Like if you turned your oven on closed the oven door and tried get warm by your oven. Rarely am I not happy with a product or write many reviews. Not happy. Probably too costly and pain in butt to return since I don’t have the packaging so threw $130 out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Tara C

customer_reviews.title: Lame 82 degree limit. Run a fan on it to keep thermostat from cutting off
customer_reviews.text: 82 degrees would be reasonable, but the thermostat is on the unit so, while the unit reads 82 and cuts off, your room will be much cooler unless you run a fan by the unit. Not sure if this heat limit is unique to this unit or a result of some ridiculous new regulation to prevent global warming or something. If so, time to turn to ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Gentleman of the Road

customer_reviews.title: Great heater!
customer_reviews.text: This gives off some good heat! We use this in our son's room which happens to be one of the coldest rooms in our house due to it being in the corner and gets the most wind. The eco mode is a bit loud with clicking on and off and doesn't seem to put off much heat so we don't use the eco mode. Love the control panel and ease of use. Great for small - medium rooms. I don't think it would heat the hole house, but that's not what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D

customer_reviews.title: one is perfect and other makes a ridiculous loud banging noise
customer_reviews.text: Own two of these, one is perfect and other makes a ridiculous loud banging noise. Will update review pending return.
customer_reviews.author: Tinglesaver

customer_reviews.title: A Heater That Works.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years and let it go. Very sorry I did that. This unit sits on a glass enclosed porch in CT. The winters are cold and I bring tropical fruit plants inside. This unit keeps the night time temps just where I want them. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST HEATER FOR A LARGE ROOM OR ROOMS
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent heater! I have 3 of them for my house which is overkill but better to be safe than sorry. Having 3 I believe helps to cut down on my electric bill because the 2 that I have in my very large living room/kitchen do not have to work as hard. Best oil filled heater out there right now.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE IN NEW YORK

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you don't need it connected to any type of timer switch.
customer_reviews.text: Ours is very quiet. I keep it in eco mode set at 70 degrees F. I initially wanted to hook it up to a WeMo switch but whenever the WeMo switch went off, the heater would not turn back on when the power to the heater was turned on again. Hence, it can't be hooked up to any type of timer switch. I would have given it 5 stars if it could work on a timer. It does have a very basic timer built in but this cannot be set to a certain time on or off.
customer_reviews.author: H. V. Devera

customer_reviews.title: Beware, doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Heads up, all controls stopped working after 3 years. The temperature is now constant (won’t let me decrease it which is scary) and the automatic functionality ceased working too. Also noticed when I turn the power off it keeps radiating heat. Can only fully shut it off by unplugging it. It worked great prior to this but not acceptable to only last 3 years
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clodfelder

customer_reviews.title: Great radiant heat
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job heating my basement. I do not have an issue with the noise as some have suggested. It is my only heat for my basement and ran pretty much full-tilt all season long during a never-ending winter, held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I needed this for supplemental heat and it perfect. It produces a lot of heat and the timer function is ideal given how quiet the unit is (you can easily forget that it is on). It is built well and the sturdy wheels make moving it very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As noisy as an old clock
customer_reviews.text: Do you remember those old clocks you could never sleep with? well, you got one here. After reaching your desired temp it constantly makes a very loud click noise as it turns on and off every 8 seconds or so. It will drive you crazy. Also, When you put it on energy saving it will almost never keeps up with your desired temp. For example if you have it on 70 degrees it will not go higher than 68. Basically, it's the system working at a lower wattage.
customer_reviews.author: cyrous hashemian

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This heater costs more than I wanted to spend, but it looks so stylish and I really wanted to have a timer feature so I decided to give it a try. And I’m so happy I did! It makes some popping noise the first 10-15mins when I turn it on, but I think that’s normal. It’s very powerful and heat up my living room pretty fast, but also it’s very quiet. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Hazard beware- burn oil and release gas
customer_reviews.text: This unit spilled oil and fumed oil steam after 23 months. I must have used it less than dozen times..enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth K

customer_reviews.title: This thing is going to save me money.
customer_reviews.text: The energy settings let you put it to the exact setting you need. You can even restrict the maximum amount of energy it's allowed to use to help make sure it only heats as much as I want. Right now I got it set up near my salamander so it'll guarantee comfort in that area while keeping the house thermostat down to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works as advertised. I have it in all day, it’s super quiet and the heat is all throughout the room. (Maybe even a little further) I haven’t had any of the pings people talk about, you’d never even know it’s in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Quiet amazing heat
customer_reviews.text: silent heat that really warms up a big poorly insulated sun room. The downside is is an oil heater. I have used it 5-6 times and there is a slight oil odor. I've used this type before, it will go away.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: I believe this gave my furnace a "break" from continuously running for days on end...
customer_reviews.text: This heater delivered as advertised. I liked the digital panel as after initial setup I was able to adjust easily as needed with the thermometers placed strategically in the areas to be heated. This prevented pipes from freezing in the brutally sub zero temps in the northeast this winter. It moves over all surfaces easily. As expected, when on high it gets extremely hot to the touch. Normal safety precautions should eliminate any possible issues. I am planning to purchase another unit of the same model. By using this heater it allowed my thermostat to be satisfied and my furnace did not run continuously for days on end. I used the unit primarily during the sub zero nights.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker "Tom"

customer_reviews.title: For occupied living space only
customer_reviews.text: Excellent upgrade to the previous models. A word of warning though, unlike the simpler models, it will not turn back on if there is a power outage. I bought it to keep a space warm during freezing temperatures to prevent water lines from bursting. I came in to check on it and it was off and the timer was not being utilized. We had just had an interruption in power that morning. Prior to that, it had stayed on for months, with continuous heating. So, with that in mind, it serves as a good heat source but only for an occupied living area. Not for freeze protection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... radiators for over 20 years and they just make great reliable radiators
customer_reviews.text: I have used Delonghi radiators for over 20 years and they just make great reliable radiators! I still have another one from early 1990's that works perfectly, although the newer one has digital controls and ECO mode to save power - This model was no exception as to the quality and performance - heats the entire apartment up very toasty - no brainer to recommend this product a "buy" if your in the market for a heater - blows away space heaters
customer_reviews.author: David de Groot

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Description says its good enough for room but its not it took ages to make room comfortable. If room is already warm this can keep the room warm but it will not work for cold room may be for very small room
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: For the most part really nice heater. Minus one star because of failure to ...
customer_reviews.text: It heats the room I purchased it for. I also understood prior to purchase that the timer was not a 24 hour timer. That is it could be programmed to go on every day at 5am. I did think without researching I could use a 24 hour timer in the wall plug and plug the heater in to that. When I program it to come on due to the electronic switches and thermostat it will not turn on. For the most part really nice heater. Minus one star because of failure to be able to program with a 24 hour timer.
customer_reviews.author: stheodd1

customer_reviews.title: Great job heating my office
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this radiator is put together, some complained about the new smell (which was quit bad). I but the radiator in my garage, set it on high temp and let it cook all day. Shut it off for the night and then repeated the process the next day. by the end of the 2nd day there was hardly any smell left. I use it in my office, around 250 square ft. with a 10ft ceiling. Very comfortable even when temps were very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Yoder

customer_reviews.title: Very Noisy
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a good heater in terms of actual heating, BUT- it won't stop making clicking/ticking/popping noises during the whole night, waking my wife and me constantly. I have had radiant heaters in the past, but I never came across any of them making such loud noises. At this point, I think we are going to stop using the heater in our bedroom and just get a new one- it's impossible to get any good sleep with those noises. Only get it for the bedroom if you are a heavy sleeper and don't wake up from noises.
customer_reviews.author: Chanan S.

customer_reviews.title: When you need a little heat in one area.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan and sometimes I need a little extra heat in one room and don't want to turn up the heat in the entire house. Think new baby, having the flu which might leave you with a chill. That kind of a little extra heat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Puscheck

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No complaints. People complain about knocking, but this one very rarely makes very soft pings. I don’t run it on high though. You mileage may vary. It’s designed to radiate energy, that energy may be expressed as sound waves, such is the nature of all things.
customer_reviews.author: tangerinewolverine

customer_reviews.title: Well designed oil heater
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully designed oil heater, looks great and wheels are easy to start using and unit can be easily moved. Completely quiet, odor free, and heats up very fast. Improvements could be made to the display to show current air temp, and an option to show the remaining time left for hours set for heat to be on.
customer_reviews.author: MitchellD

customer_reviews.title: Beware: NOT Programmable.
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed that so many reviews have been written without mentioning the one most salient problem with this heater. The fancy electronic controls are NOT 24 hour programmable. It only has a delayed on/off TIMER. Why they would not make a fully programmable heater is completely beyond me. This one is going back
customer_reviews.author: Vivekanand Chivukula

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Look no further this is the heater you want. I plug this puppy in on cold nights and it keeps the room toasty. Great heater.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Grim

customer_reviews.title: Makes heat, and a lot of noise
customer_reviews.text: Really like the heater...except for the horrendously loud "bong" about every 30 minutes. Impossible to use it in a bedroom as it wakes us up every time.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Provides steady heat & quiet to run.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to keep half of our house warm (cathedral ceiling encompassing the kitchen, dining room & living room) as we had removed an old heater to place new flooring. They do a great job. Some people mention the clicking noises but I only hear that when I first turn them on. Once on, they are quiet & can really put out the heat. I even bought a 3rd unit for another room.
customer_reviews.author: lp

customer_reviews.title: Keeps big room warm
customer_reviews.text: I was first concerned, that it wouldn't heat our living room + dining room, but I am surprised, that if I keep it on during the day, the rooms are at 23C or 23.5C and at night I turn it to Eco and a light setting, still 20C. Satisfied and would buy again! It would just be nice if companies come up with innovative design ideas, and not these boring shapes, but I guess that is the designer in me that speaks :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second heat source for my 13 X 23 ft bedroom to eliminate the chill I feel between furnace cycles. Granted, Im not using it as the only heat source, but this thing puts off enough heat to be the only heat source. My only gripe is, when the digital display goes dim (which it does a few seconds after you touch a button) its very difficult to see if the heater actually heating or not as it cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Loyer

customer_reviews.title: oil fumes
customer_reviews.text: The heater is looking nice and is easy to use. It does a reasonable job in heating, but nothing beyond what a cheap $40 heater can do. It also has a couple of issues. Construction of its metal plates is such that heater makes a loud clicking sound when it is heating up or cooling down. But the most annoying issue is oily smell which comes from it, especially at high settings. The last issue constantly makes me regret that I have chosen and purchased this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Evgenia

customer_reviews.title: Not convinced yet
customer_reviews.text: Not as hot as our cheaper Delonghi oil heater. Not sure if this fancy version is worth the extra $ but love these heaters and great quality from Delonghi
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, reliable and energy efficient
customer_reviews.text: I use this down cellar to keep my pipes from freezing. Since it has a built in thermostat, it only turns on when the temperature drops below the setting I entered. We have had a few "arctic blasts" this winter, which used to always cause my pipes to freeze. I can't believe it took me this long to think of keeping them warm at the source. I have tried the heat tapes but they only kick in when the pipes are already frozen. Plus they are a PITA to install.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with delonghi
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a nice unit but it takes almost an hour to heat up and it will not put out alot of heat.. i let this run for almost 3 hours and barely did anything in my closed off living room. The controls are great its a quality built unit but if it does not put out heat its pointless
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Heater works well.
customer_reviews.text: This heater works well. The sides get pretty warm, but not too hot to touch. Heat rises from the top to warm the room. There is no noise, which is great. The only negative would be that the power cable comes out from the front side where the LCD panel is, instead of the opposite side, so the front of the heater tends to face towards the wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: ... get a 2 car garage from below freezing to comfortably cool using this and some foam/foil insulation
customer_reviews.text: Managed to get a 2 car garage from below freezing to comfortably cool using this and some foam/foil insulation. Only downside is that on the max setting the heater gives off an odd chemical smell. Supposedly it'll burn off, but it's been a couple of weeks and it's still making the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use anywhere
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought us one of these several years ago. It worked like a charm for more than ten years. It is perfect for any room or garage area. It is quiet while running, has a temperature control and three settings low, med, and high. Just bought two of these.
customer_reviews.author: proudgrandma

customer_reviews.title: temperature control is excellent
customer_reviews.text: My model did not come with a remote control, however set up was easy and instructions were easy to follow. experimented a couple of nights with temperature setting, but once we determined what worked best, nights have been comfortably warm.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent O

customer_reviews.title: This works well to keep a 150 square feet room ...
customer_reviews.text: This works well to keep a 150 square feet room about 5 degrees cooler than the rest of the house. The unit mostly operates on the low heat setting. If the unit is set on high, the outside of the fin covers or grates can feel very hot. To break in this unit I vacuumed out all of the polystyrene packing remnants. Once cleaned, I ran the unit on high for a day in my garage. This did make my garage smelly for about 4 hours. I haven't noticed any off putting smells from this unit since.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: ... world of portable heaters it is one of the better constructed ones I have seen
customer_reviews.text: In the world of portable heaters it is one of the better constructed ones I have seen. It emits a constant warm heat that radiates throughout the room. Settings are easy to access and use. As others have mentioned, the unit does does give off an "I'm new and have never been used" odor - so I operated it outside for several hours which really helped a lot. I love this product and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Did a well job heating the area silently after the initial popping sound of the oil warming
customer_reviews.author: G. Soza

customer_reviews.title: In the heat of the moment
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived promptly, exactly as described. Very quiet, and once it heats up it radiates. theres no fan so its quiet, but a fan nearby might help distribute the heat. Nice clean looking lines for a space heater. Has wheels to easily lug around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miklovis

customer_reviews.title: Safe way to heat your space
customer_reviews.text: Nit sure about the remote maybe lost in the packing material but it is very nice and my dogs are delighted to have this new source of heat with our recent cold weather
customer_reviews.author: Linda Logan

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent heater! This was the second unit I've purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Most excellent heater! This was the second unit I've purchased after being so pleased with the first. No more cold bedroom, as this unit is far more efficient than the old fan heater in the wall! Update: 9-2020 I've purchased a third for a friend and the neighbors on both sides of me as have purchased this same heater for themselves, silent clean comfortable heat!😊
customer_reviews.author: X-raydave

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: We use it in a large area with tree rooms and a hallway.. Made a big difference and affordable to use. This is quiet operation and good source of hear.. Saves running the whole house heater all the time
customer_reviews.author: RomReader

customer_reviews.title: Loud metallic popping sound from heating/cooling of metal case
customer_reviews.text: This heater is great except for one problem: when it is heating, every so often it makes a very loud metallic popping sound, like someone hitting a steel drum. This is due to the metal changing shape when it heats. The sound wakes me up when I'm sleeping, which negates the whole point of getting this heater—I was hoping for silent heating.
customer_reviews.author: jbj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4000 square foot home. It is heated with propane. Depending on the price of propane each year it can cost approximately $700.00 per month to heat. I ordered three DeLonghi heaters and placed them carefully around the house. I am now saving about $650.00 per month in heating costs. As a matter of fact, I never have to turn the heat on. And I live just north of Green Bay Wisconsin. Awesome product DeLonghi. Go Packers.
customer_reviews.author: mark gribble

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased this model.
customer_reviews.text: In 2.5 year olds room. Works very well and no issues with surface heat for 2.5 year old or 4 ear old. Works well to maintain temperature in colder room. Increase in energy bill was as expected for oil heater - not free but not substantial.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: A Great Little Heater
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! The heat this device quietly produces in the first floor master bedroom could run you out of there if you set it to full blast. I don't and it does a great job. Combined with a humidifier, it is part of a 1-2 punch that we use to battle the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Land Shark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This heater is made for up to 250 sq ft rooms, and mine is 135 sq ft so it was perfect. Honestly I love this heater. I noticed it makes two kinds of clicking noises - one not so loud, and one a liiiiitttle but louder, but if you aren’t annoyed by ticking clocks in a bedroom, then this shouldn’t bother you. I also don’t recommend putting it right next to your bed if even the smallest clicking noises bother you (mine is near the entrance so I feel the warmth the moment I walk in). I don’t have a comforter and just use a blanket when I sleep because the heat is so perfectly balanced. Love this heater!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: smells like burndt plastic - even after 3 months of continuous use (also, arrived already open)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because it seemed really good. But the moment I got it I felt there was something strange. The box was already open and it looked as if it was a refurbished or an item someone returned (not new). I decided to keep because I really needed that. From the very first moment I started using, I smelt burndt plastic. I checked the reviews and the brand info and it mentioned it was common and that it would disapear in a few weeks. Never did. It always smells like something in burning, plastic. I woudn't buy it again, don't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeferson Pulz

customer_reviews.title: quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep my bedroom (20x16) warm at night so I don't have to keep my whole house heated. Our outside temps are in the 30-40s at night. Absolutely a great purchase. doesn't make bit of noise you won't know its on until you see the light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Silent Heat !
customer_reviews.text: We use this oil heater in the workshop , it has replaced two low cost oil type heaters and actually produces more heat than the other heaters together ! We do not detect any odor whatsoever . Simply follow the instructions for start up and initial operation before closing yourself in a room with it . The best oil radiator self contained unit we have ever used to heat our 250 sq ft shop . The timer feature is great , turns the unit on an hour before I get there so I walk into a warm shop , very nice .
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Really good heat, no noise issues
customer_reviews.text: Albeit a bit slow to heat up, it stays warm longer. Occasional clicks from going on and off, not really an issue. The deign is nice and enclosed, with vents on top for warm air to escape, and the slats to radiate heat. Only downside is does not have a remote, but not really too much of an issue by setting it to the eco mode. Overall would recommend for the winter for small to medium sized room.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this heater for a little over a month now. I’m using it in my detached office at home. It’s doing a great job reading my office and keeping things warm. Previously I had to in wall electric heaters that never really got the room warm. But this little unit does a great job of warming it up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Davis

customer_reviews.title: This heater is perfect for warming garage
customer_reviews.text: Husband likes to work in garage and this heater certainly takes the edge off the cold when he does. IT is not going to make garage warm as toast but at least your fingers will be able to work.. Glad we bought it
customer_reviews.author: Peg V.

customer_reviews.title: Very well engineered, quality heater
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic heater. On wheels, excellent & accurate heat production. Easy to operate. Would be perfect if it had remote control. I use it to warm a 16' x 18' room - easily heats this room!
customer_reviews.author: drkknight196

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this oil-filled heater on my bed room. It takes some time to heat up the room, but once it heats up it stays pretty much constant temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: while being unobtrusive and except for a few cool down 'ticks'
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater to help stabilize the temperature in my bedroom (about 200 sq ft) during a particularly cold and miserable winter. It simply does exactly what you expect, while being unobtrusive and except for a few cool down 'ticks', you don't really notice it. It kept my room comfortable and was able to heat up quickly when needed, and also help out just enough on those days when I just needed another 1-2 degrees over what my floor heating could manage.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Monkee Photography

product_meta.title: De'Longhi Oil-Filled Radiator Space Heater, Quiet 1500W, Adjustable Thermostat, 3 Heat Settings, Timer, Energy Saving, Safety Features, Nice for Home with Pets / Kids, Light Gray, TRD40615E
product_meta.description: Color:Light GrayFrom the inventors of the oil filled category comes a revolutionary new design that effectively and efficiently heats room air with convection and also has 25% more radiant surface to quickly heat people in the room. The new heater design features thermal chimneys to provide maximum heating while ensuring a low surface temperature, making the radiator a nice choice for homes with pets or kids. The user-friendly control panel offers an adjustable thermostat and variable heat settings to customize your heating needs and optimize energy-efficient operation. For added energy savings it also features a 24-hour programmable timer. The anti-freeze setting allows the unit to automatically turn on when the temperature drops below 44 degrees F. Safety highlights include rust-resistant durable metal construction, a modern design, and a thermal cut-off function that automatically turns the heater off if it starts to overheat.
feature_bullets: Durable & maintenance-free: Patented, high-quality steel assembly and the permanently-sealed oil reservoir never needs refilling
Radiant Heat: 1500 watts of heating power for quiet, full room comfort
Personalized comfort: Customize to your heating needs with an adjustable thermostat and three heat settings.Heating power - Min (W): 700
Patented thermal slots: Unique thermal slot design maximizes heat flow into the room while maintaining a low surface temperature
Peace of mind: Features a thermal shutoff to prevent overheating

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,454 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
